message: Ive heard alot about a divorse settlement sums of £50 billion. But no mention of the UK entitlement to a percentage of the EU assets such as building ect.  It would seem proper that our liability to the EU on leaving be off set against the value of our she of  assets ?

That sum is based on commitments the UK made under pre-established budgetary agreements.
What you are trying to do is conflate payments to diverse EU programmes, with returnable investments. The EU countries do not each "own a share of" all EU buildings, much like Scotland, Wales or Ireland do not "own a share of Westminster" .

No Malcolm Healey, but we did help massively build what it is today. Expecially over eastern Europe. We have almost single handedly given Poland a better economy. I think we have helped enough to not justify a 50 billion debt. Also we want to be able to still fund the good projects they are doing. We owe them nothing.

Michael Hare 
On helping in a massive way, yes that part is true. Yet the UK also benefited massively through its selling of services and financial passporting arrangements. 
I think places like Germany, the Netherlands and Austria would take issue with "the UK singlehandedly giving Poland a better economy. Not everything positive is down to the UK, not everything negative is down to the EU, learn some nuance, or at least sourcing for your claims.

The UK does not "owe" indeed, the UK of their own free will, signed up to agreements and made pledges. The EU expects the UK to make good on its word. After all, that wouldn't set a very good precedent for the rest of the world that the UK wants to increase trade with, if the UK's first act of leaving the EU is going back on its word. How valuable would any agreement with the UK be, if the UK starts by showing it will break agreements unilaterally?

After 70 years on this planet, Africa still has famine, there are wars around the world, liberals still believe Communism works, the EEC (European Economic Community) I voted for in the 70's was hijacked by France and Germany and became the political power base ruling Europe and don't get me started on the non contributing EU States! An American Mad Man instead of a German and Italian Mad Man is in power! There's a Brexit parallel to Henry VIII here!
No turning back. Leavers its over to you.  Its your Country now.
Well that's the great Merkel derailed the pretend pm plans lol
Theresa much FUN working on 20.833 Contracts to revise - might be possible that you rethink- "no turning back" after not paying 60 Bn €?
'No turning back' except there is, A50 is not an absolute. Can any Brexiter go a day without lying?
Or a remainer without scaremongering!!

So many of your fellow travellers have already shuffled off, still not long now eh?
